data.name: Log-Likelihood Evaluation
data.settings: Datasets: MNIST, CIFAR-10, ImageNet (32x32), and CelebA. Evaluation Metrics: Log-likelihood per dimension (bits/dim). Baselines: Various deep generative models, including PixelRNN, PixelCNN, and VAEs.
data.results: MNIST: -1.06 bits/dim; CIFAR-10: -3.49 bits/dim; ImageNet (32x32): -3.86 bits/dim; CelebA: -3.45 bits/dim. Strong performance attributed to the model's ability to learn complex, multi-modal distributions and compute exact log-likelihoods.

data.name: Sample Generation
data.settings: Datasets: MNIST, CIFAR-10, ImageNet (32x32), and CelebA. Evaluation Metrics: Visual inspection of generated samples and quantitative metrics like Inception Score and Fréchet Inception Distance (FID).
data.results: MNIST: Visually indistinguishable from real data; CIFAR-10: High diversity and quality, clear and sharp images; ImageNet (32x32): Diverse and realistic, capturing various textures and structures; CelebA: Highly realistic and varied faces. High-quality samples due to exact and efficient sampling mechanism.

data.name: Latent Variable Inference
data.settings: Datasets: MNIST, CIFAR-10, ImageNet (32x32), and CelebA. Evaluation Metrics: Reconstruction error, visual inspection of reconstructed images, and interpretability of latent variables.
data.results: MNIST: Accurate reconstructions with interpretable latent space; CIFAR-10: High-quality reconstructions, latent space captures important features; ImageNet (32x32): Accurate reconstructions, manipulation of image attributes; CelebA: Highly realistic reconstructions, manipulation of facial features. Successful reconstruction and interpretable latent space due to exact and efficient inference capabilities.

data.name: Model Interpretability
data.settings: Datasets: MNIST, CIFAR-10, ImageNet (32x32), and CelebA. Evaluation Metrics: Visualization of the latent space, manipulation of latent variables, and qualitative assessment of changes in generated samples.
data.results: MNIST: Smooth transitions between digits; CIFAR-10: Coherent transformations of objects; ImageNet (32x32): Realistic changes in image attributes; CelebA: Realistic modifications of facial features. Emphasizes the interpretability of the latent space and the ability to manipulate latent variables for coherent changes in generated samples.
